TopicTitle: [1.5.1] Engine Lighting (1.5.1) Little Config Update (13 October)

Articles.Content: That's great! I was actually planning to create a similar plugin, but I'm glad to discover it already exists!
This mod would be SO COOL if lights didn't kill my frame rate;.;

> 
> This mod would be SO COOL if lights didn't kill my frame rate;.;

Reducing the number of "Pixel Lights Count" and/or "Shadow Cascades" in KSP settings should solve it.

If you put only 1 pixel lights it means only the strongest light (usually the sun) will have shadows and shader effects (reflections, bump mapping, etc...), which is usually good enough ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Reducing the number of "Pixel Lights Count" and/or "Shadow Cascades" in KSP settings should solve it.
> If you put only 1 pixel lights it means only the strongest light (usually the sun) will have shadows and shader effects (reflections, bump mapping, etc...), which is usually good enough ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Hey, that worked! Just finished testing on the launch pad. I ended up with setting pixel light count =6 and shadow cascades = 1, and it looks like I still get the same visuals as default. I'll play around with it some more if need be.

Now, if I could only find a way to reduce the load of engine smoke, I'll have lag free-ish launches!

With shadow cascades = 1 you should get very pixelated shadows, which is fine if you are not zooming too much ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Nope, stock engine smoke effects. It always gives me horrible frame rate drop when a lot of smoke builds up, like at launch. Turning off AA fixes it, but then I lose part highlighting.

Sorry for getting off topic by the way.
Wow, didn't know I need it, now cannot play without it! Night launches FTW!!
But it is normal that it costs so many fps? In a small part count ship like the stock Kerbal X it can cost about 4 fps...
So, this also affects to the prop engines added by Firespitter plugin mods. Any chance of compatibility for that?
That is quite awesome. One of these small but important mods that transforms the game in something even more amazing.
Oooh nice mod. Now night time landing is a bit easier!

Just found that Area lights are baked only... Welp, we are stuck with point lights, but i'm implementing a little Flickering effect! (And also placing the light at the flame)

About the firespitter props emiting light, i will disable the light on them for the next release. For now you can patch them using a MM config. Take a look at the patches.cfg file ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

(Will possibly release a fixed .cfg soon)

EDIT: That replaced light will possibly make the lighting much more realistic, as right now it looks a bit weird (The light is inside the nozzle)

Cheers! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

You can use this page to generate the file: [http://ksp-avc.cybutek.net](http://ksp-avc.cybutek.net)

Or here is a file I just whipped up for you. Just save it in the directory with the suffix being .version

    {
      "NAME":"Engine Lighting",
      "URL":"http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121987",
